original_text:
Money Pig
Come dare perle ai porci potrebbe non essere solo un modo di dire, ma diventare un vero e proprio tema attorno al quale ruota una slot machine. Ne è un esempio Money Pig, titolo della Capecod che ruota attorno a due elementi: la ricchezza e l’animale di cui non si butta via niente.
In questa recensione andremo a vederne l’aspetto puramente estetico e quello tecnico, al fine di offrire un quadro più completo possibile ai potenziali giocatori.
Money Pig: analisi grafica
Cominciamo dall’aspetto più immediato nella nostra valutazione: quello visivo. La slot si apre con una musica di atmosfera delicata ma accattivante allo stesso tempo, la quale non risulta fastidiosa durante la partita sebbene tra le opzioni sia possibile disattivarla.
I simboli che affollano la griglia di gioco rappresentano i vari volti della ricchezza e si passa dal diamante (il simbolo dal valore maggiore) per poi scendere al gettone del maiale, le banconote e l’anello. A questi si aggiungono altri 4 simboli molto comuni nelle slot machine, ovvero quelli delle carte da gioco (A, K, Q e J). Questi, che rappresentano le vincite dal valore minore, sono rappresentati come scritte al neon, dando loro un aspetto più moderno e più in linea con il tema.
Oltre al gettone, i simboli relativi al maiale di cui si parla nel titolo sono riservati alle funzioni speciali, di cui parleremo nel punto successivo nella recensione.
Infine i colori della slot sono l’oro e il viola, entrambi simboli di opulenza, che non affaticano gli occhi durante le varie giocate.
Money Pig: come si gioca?
Passiamo all’analisi più tecnica: ci troviamo di fronte a una griglia di gioco 5*3, con cinque rulli che ruotano su loro stessi e si fermano lungo tre linee orizzontali. Se la matematica non è un’opinione, il risultato di questa intersezione sono i quindici simboli che vengono mostrati a ogni giocata.
Il giocatore può personalizzare il proprio gameplay cambiando il numero di linee di vincite e il valore in monete di ogni moneta lungo tali line, passando da una giocata dal valore minimo di 1 al valore massimo di 150.
Le linee di vincita, infatti, raggiungono un valore massimo di 15, piuttosto poche rispetto agli standard normali online, che porta ad avere un numero minore di vincite ma dal valore maggiore.
I simboli speciali a cui abbiamo accennato prima son o due: il maialino a salvadanaio è un simbolo Wild che può sostituire tutti gli altri in gioco (tranne l’altro speciale), e il titolo stesso della slot appare come simbolo Scatter che può dare accesso alla modalità bonus in cui il giocatore dovrà scegliere una gemma e otterrà una vincita casuale associata ad essa.
La slot ha quindi un funzionamento piuttosto diretto ed è di facile intuizione, anche per i giocatori meno avvezzi a questo mondo.
Titoli simili a Money Pig
Dato che questo è uno dei titoli della Capecod, è consigliabile provare le altre slot di questa casa di sviluppo, come Bomber Fruit Slot per chi cerca il classico tema fruttifero nel proprio gioco o I Pirati del Bounty per coloro che cercano qualche emozione in più durante la propria partita.
Il maiale, inoltre, non è un animale particolarmente lontano dal mondo delle slot, proprio per la sua somiglianza con determinati salvadanai: per questo consigliamo anche la slot Smash The Pig della G2 Spielo.

raw_translation.response:
Money Pig
"Daring to cast pearls before swine" may not just be a turn of phrase, but could become a theme around which a slot machine revolves. An example of this is Money Pig, a Capecod title that revolves around two elements: wealth and the animal from which nothing is wasted.
In this review, we will examine the purely aesthetic and technical aspects in order to offer potential players as complete a picture as possible.
Money Pig: graphic analysis
Let's start with the most immediate aspect in our evaluation: the visual. The slot opens with gentle but captivating background music, which is not annoying during the game, although it is possible to turn it off among the options.
The symbols that populate the game grid represent the various faces of wealth, ranging from the diamond (the symbol with the highest value) to the piggy bank token, banknotes, and the ring. In addition to these, there are 4 symbols that are very common in slot machines, representing the lower-value winnings, which are represented as neon signs, giving them a more modern and in-line look with the theme.
In addition to the token, the symbols related to the pig mentioned in the title are reserved for special functions, which we will discuss in the next point of the review.
Finally, the colors of the slot are gold and purple, both symbols of opulence, which do not strain the eyes during the various plays.
Money Pig: how to play?
Let's move on to the more technical analysis: we are faced with a game grid of 5*3, with five reels that rotate on themselves and stop along three horizontal lines. If math is not a matter of opinion, the result of this intersection is the fifteen symbols shown at each play.
The player can customize their gameplay by changing the number of paylines and the value of each coin along those lines, ranging from a minimum value of 1 to a maximum of 150.
In fact, the paylines reach a maximum value of 15, quite few compared to normal online standards, which leads to a smaller number of winnings but with a higher value.
The special symbols we mentioned earlier are two: the piggy bank is a Wild symbol that can replace all others in the game (except the other special one), and the title of the slot itself appears as a Scatter symbol that can give access to the bonus mode in which the player must choose a gem and will receive a random payout associated with it.
The slot, therefore, has a fairly straightforward operation and is easy to understand, even for players less accustomed to this world.
Titles similar to Money Pig
Since this is one of the Capecod titles, it is advisable to try the other slots of this development house, such as Bomber Fruit Slot for those looking for the classic fruit theme in their game or The Bounty Pirates for those looking for some extra excitement during their game.
The pig is also not an animal particularly far from the world of slots, precisely because of its similarity to certain piggy banks: for this reason, we also recommend the slot Smash the Pig from G2 Spielo.

response.headline: Money Pig Slot Game
response.content: Money Pig is an online slot game developed by Capecod, revolving around the theme of wealth and pigs. The game has five reels with three horizontal lines and fifteen symbols displayed at each game. The graphics of the game are gold and purple, representing opulence, and the symbols depict faces of wealth, including diamond, pig token, banknotes, and ring, and playing cards symbols (A, K, Q, J).

Review: Money Pig
To throw pearls to the pigs may not just be a saying, but it can become a true theme around which a slot machine revolves. One example is Money Pig, a title by Capecod that revolves around two elements: wealth and the animal that wastes nothing.
In this review, we will examine its purely aesthetic and technical aspects, in order to offer a more complete picture to potential players.
Money Pig: graphic analysis
Let's start with the most immediate aspect in our evaluation: the visual one. The slot opens with a delicate but captivating atmospheric music, which does not become annoying during the game, although it is possible to disable it among the options.
The symbols that crowd the game grid represent the various faces of wealth, ranging from the diamond (the symbol with the highest value) to the pig token, banknotes and the ring. In addition, there are other 4 symbols very common in slot machines, namely those of the playing cards (A, K, Q and J). These, representing the winnings of the lower value, are represented as neon signs, giving them a more modern look in line with the theme.
In addition to the token, the symbols related to the pig mentioned in the title are reserved for special functions, which we will discuss in the next point in the review.
Finally, the colors of the slot are gold and purple, both symbols of opulence, which do not strain the eyes during the various plays.
Money Pig: how to play?
Let's move on to the more technical analysis: we are facing a 5*3 game grid, with five reels that spin on themselves and stop along three horizontal lines. If mathematics isn't an opinion, the result of this intersection is the fifteen symbols displayed at each game.
The player can customize their gameplay by changing the number of winning lines and the value in coins of each coin along such lines, going from a minimum value of 1 to a maximum value of 150.
The winning lines, in fact, reach a maximum value of 15, rather few compared to normal online standards, which leads to having a lower number of winnings but with a higher value.
The special symbols we mentioned before are two: the piggy bank piglet is a Wild symbol that can replace all the others in the game (except the other special one), and the title of the slot itself appears as a Scatter symbol that can give access to the bonus mode in which the player will have to choose a gem and will get a random winning associated with it.
The slot machine therefore has a rather direct functioning and is easy to understand, even for players less accustomed to this world.
Similar titles to Money Pig
Since this is one of Capecod's titles, it is advisable to try out the other slots by this development company, such as Bomber Fruit Slot for those looking for the classic fruit-themed game in their game or The Bounty Pirates for those who want some extra excitement during their game.
Moreover, the pig is not an animal particularly distant from the world of slot machines, precisely because of its resemblance to certain piggy banks: for this reason, we also recommend the slot Smash The Pig by G2 Spielo.

The slot has two special symbols, one of which is a piglet of a piggy bank symbol, which acts as a Wild symbol and can replace all other symbols in the game except for the other special symbol, represented by the title of the slot itself, which appears as a Scatter symbol that can give access to the bonus mode. The bonus mode requires the player to choose a gem, and they will then get a random winning associated with it.

Aesthetics and symbols

Money Pig is a gold and purple-themed online slot game that represents opulence and wealth. The game opens with a captivating atmospheric music that does not become annoying during gameplay, but players have the option to disable it. The symbols that decorate the grid represent wealth in all its forms, from diamonds (the highest value symbol) to the pig token, banknotes, and the ring. The game also has four symbols representing playing cards (A, K, Q, and J) which are neon signs, giving them a modern look in line with the theme.

Special symbols

Money Pig has two special symbols, which include the piggy bank piglet symbol and the title of the slot symbol. The piggy bank piglet is a Wild symbol that can replace all symbols in the game except for the other special symbol, represented by the title of the slot itself, which appears as a Scatter symbol and gives access to the bonus mode.

Similar slot games

For players that enjoy Capecod's titles, it is advisable to try out other slots by the same development company, such as Bomber Fruit Slot, which features a classic fruit-themed game, or The Bounty Pirates, which offers an exciting theme. Other similar games include Smash The Pig by G2 Spielo, which also features a pig as its main symbol.
